title.content-text: 3.1.1 - O S I and TCP/IP Model

brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts a person communicating over the network and the interaction between people, software, hardware, and the O S I model. Multiple steps describe the interaction. An end user is sitting next to a computer with the seven (unlabeled) layers of the O S I model pointing to it. The O S I model has a link coming from the bottom Physical Layer going to a switch, which then connects to a router. The router connects to a WAN link.

Step 1. Initial display of the user at a computer and O S I Model.
Step 2. Text over user: "People create the communication."
Step 3. Text over computer: "Software and hardware convert communication to a digital format."
Step 4. Application Layer 7 is labeled. Text over Application Layer: "Application Layer services initiate the data transfer."
Step 5. Envelope packet starts at Layer 7 and arrow points down the stack and to the switch. Text: "The Application Layer prepares human communication for transmission over the data network."
Step 6. Envelope packet comes back from the switch and returns to the user. Text: "The Application Layer receives data from the network and prepares it for human use."
Other layers of the O S I Model are now labeled. Text: "Each layer plays its role."
